title: Why are Assassin and Fighter players so unpleasant?
body: Most assassin and fighter players are the most unpleasant people in this game. If you ban {{champion:157}} in a game, you get rage from either your team or the enemy team, its not my fault he is one of the most toxic champions ever to exist in League and banning him is healthy for the game. Why are these people so immature and toxic and why does Riot continue to pander to people that play this toxic champions? Do they spend more money because its dragging League down.

replies.body:
Stereotyping is bad.

Why don't people figure that out?
high mobility + dmg ----> flashy "plays" ---> inflated ego ---> arrogant attitude
From the mentality of a yasuo player, the reason they tend to be unpleasant is likely the thought that they HAVE to make plays
Eh Riven, Yasuo, and for some reason Nasus mains are the worst I have come across.
For me mage mains are the actual cancer because they ALWAYS call their class weak even if it's not

They're all tryhards who think they can be "cool" and "edgy" when in reality they have really fragile egos that are shielded by this front, and when something shatters their front, they come to pieces.

Well if you ban the champion your teammate wanted to play ofcourse they will be mad, i personally think adc mains and sometimes support mains who behave like they sit on the highest horse are the worst.

Yesterday i watched a nighblue stream in which his top yaduo 0/3 flamed all game long.

Funny how stereotypes are true
